I don't have an answer for you, but I do have a question.  Why would you
want to do this?  One of the strengths of the framework (IMHO) is the
guidance it gives me to fix every test incrementally.  I am unclear on why
you would want the test to go on.  It seems to me that you would end up
biting off more than you can chew.

    > Hi,
    > 
    > When I run my test suite I found that each test stops 
    > running after the
    > first failed assertion. I have a number of assertions in 
    > each test and I
    > would like to know every assertion that is broken. I have tried to
    > create a default TestResult inside each test using,
    > 
    > 	TestResult result = createResult();
    > 
    > and then adding failures to 'result' using,
    > 
    > 	result.addFailure(mytest, afe);
    > 
    > which works fine, except that no AssertionFailedException 
    > gets thrown
    > this way and my test passes even though I have broken assertions.
    > 
    > Is there any way I can get JUnit to show all broken 
    > assertions for each
    > test and not move onto the next test when the first 
    > assertion fails?
subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test
